sentences.chinese: 警察局长李刚儿子获刑6年。

sentences.english: Ultimately, the court verdict, Hwang jailed for 11 years.
sentences.chinese: 最终，经法院一审判决，黄某获刑11年。

sentences.english: Ms. Tian is the highest-ranking corporate executive to have been brought to trial in the scandal.
sentences.chinese: 田文华是毒奶粉丑闻中获刑的最高级管理人员。

sentences.english: Ex-Taiwan leader gets 19 yrs in jail; no appeal.
sentences.chinese: 台湾前领导人陈水扁及其子获刑19年，没有上诉。

sentences.english: If convicted, Sopo could face up to 30 years.
sentences.chinese: 如果索波获刑，他可能面临最高达到30年的处罚。

sentences.english: "I have been naive to the point of stupidity, " she said before being sentenced.
sentences.chinese: “我天真到愚蠢的地步，”她在获刑前说道。

sentences.english: China jails 8 for unrest over chef death.
sentences.chinese: 石首厨师死亡引发的骚乱中，8人获刑。

sentences.english: The former Yukos president was arrested in 2003 and charged with fraud and tax evasion.(See photo)
sentences.chinese: 霍氏曾在2003年因欺诈和逃税获刑8年。

definition: limited term of imprisonment (i.e. anything less than life imprisonment)
to raise a charge/to sue/to institute proceedings
to go to jail/to be sent to prison
lit. to get shackled and thrown in jail (idiom)/fig. to be put behind bars/to get jailed
to be a suspect (in a crime)/to be suspected of
